channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Deutsche Bank swings back to profit in the third quarter, beating expectations
item.description: The partial release of 440 million euros of litigation provisions in the third quarter helped boost profit, Deutsche Bank said.

item.title: Tokyo Metro shares surge 45% on debut after Japan's largest IPO in six years
item.description: The IPO offered 2.32 billion shares for a price of 1,200 yen apiece, valuing the offering at 348.6 billion yen ($2.3 billion)

item.title: Russia says it has no intention of abandoning Iran as it faces Israel's wrath
item.description: "We are developing cooperation with Iran in a variety of areas. We intend to do this further," Kremlin Press Secretary Dmitry Peskov told CNBC Tuesday.

item.title: China and Russia's 'profound' ties will not change despite 'turbulent' geopolitical landscape, Xi tells Putin
item.description: Putin called the partnership "one of the main stabilizing factors in the international arena."

item.title: A 'tidal wave' of natural gas supply — the biggest yet — will reshape global markets, says RBC Capital
item.description: The expansion is likely to lead to a state of oversupply by the end of 2026, analysts such as RBC's Anan Dhanani have projected.

item.title: TSMC denies U.S. is probing the company after report suggests blacklisted Huawei is using its chips
item.description: TSMC has denied a report that the U.S. is investigating its dealings with Huawei, following news that one of its chips has been found in a Huawei product.

item.title: IMF warns on China's property market worsening as it cuts country's growth outlook
item.description: In a report published Tuesday, the IMF trimmed its forecast for growth in China for this year to 4.8%, 0.2 percentage points lower than in its July projection.

item.title: ‘They want something different’: Two reports predict a big shift in travel behavior in 2025
item.description: Trend reports from Expedia and Booking.com show vacationers are forgoing splashy trips to global hot spots in favor of lesser-known places.

item.title: 'On vacation every single day': I left the U.S. to live in Vietnam and only need to work 15 hours a week
item.description: Kavi Vu, 33, moved to Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam in August 2023. Today, she lives on about $1,500 a month, according to documents reviewed.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: The S&P could still have legs despite stalling
item.description: With elections and high valuations, the path ahead for markets may be rocky. But the S&P might persist in scaling an ever-ascending mountain range.

item.title: Starbucks shares slide after coffee chain says sales fell again, suspends outlook
item.description: The company's same-store sales slid for the third consecutive quarter, fueled by a 10% tumble in traffic to its North American stores.

item.title: IMF says global fight against inflation is 'almost won' but warns of rising risks
item.description: The IMF projects global headline inflation to fall to 3.5% by the end of 2025.

item.title: SAP boss warns against regulating AI, says Europe risks falling behind U.S., China
item.description: Christian Klein, head of German software giant SAP, says Europe risks falling behind the U.S. and China if it ends up overregulating the AI sector.

item.title: World’s largest sovereign wealth fund posts $76 billion in quarterly profit as interest rates fall
item.description: Norway's gigantic sovereign wealth fund on Tuesday reported third-quarter profit of 835 billion Norwegian kroner ($76.3 billion).

item.title: Russia pushes 'new world order' agenda as it hosts beefed-up BRICS summit
item.description: Russia is rolling out the red carpet to its allies on Tuesday as it hosts the latest BRICS summit in a show of strength to the West.

item.title: McDonald's shares fall after CDC says E. coli outbreak linked to Quarter Pounders
item.description: The CDC said an E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder burgers has led to 10 hospitalizations and one death.

item.title: Paul Tudor Jones says market reckoning on spending is coming after election: 'We are going to be broke'
item.description: Hedge fund manager Paul Tudor Jones told CNBC that government spending could cause a major sell-off in the bond market.

item.title: Former Abercrombie CEO Mike Jeffries charged with sex trafficking, interstate prostitution
item.description: Abercrombie & Fitch and its former CEO Mike Jeffries were sued last year for allegedly operating a sex trafficking ring that targeted would-be male models.

item.title: Qatar Airways partners with Elon Musk’s Starlink for high-speed Wi-Fi milestone
item.description: Qatar Airways launched Tuesday its inaugural Boeing 777 flight equipped with Elon Musk's Starlink internet, paving the way for a new era of in-flight connectivity across its entire fleet by next year.

item.title: GM stock has best day since 2020 after automaker tops Wall Street's third-quarter expectations, raises guidance
item.description: GM's quarterly report comes just two weeks after an investor day in which the company indicated its earnings strength is expected to continue into next year.

item.title: HSBC embarks on major restructuring, names first female CFO
item.description: HSBC has unveiled a major overhaul, announcing a new geographic setup, consolidated operations and a new CFO — the lender's first female finance chief.

item.title: More startups are being spun out of Klarna than any other European fintech unicorn
item.description: Alumni from Klarna have gone on to create 62 new startups — more than any other fintech unicorn in Europe, according to a new report from VC firm Accel.

item.title: Hyundai Motor India's shares drop 7% on trading debut after record IPO
item.description: Hyundai Motor India shares fell 7% on their trading debut Tuesday after a record $3.3 billion initial public offering.

item.title: Economists see UK cutting interest rates more substantially as inflation pressures ease
item.description: Economists at Goldman Sachs forecast the Bank of England's key rate falling to 2.75% by November, well below market pricing.

item.title: 'New bullish phase'? As gold hits another high, analysts say more records are in sight
item.description: Gold is now in a new bullish phase after prices hit a record high, said Sprott Asset Management, echoing other bullish calls for the bullion to scale new highs.

item.title: Rosé and Bruno Mars' chart-topping track APT drives shares of media firm YG Plus to seven-month high
item.description: The track reached the top of Spotify's Top 50 Global playlist.

item.title: U.S. proposals to curb AI, semiconductor investment into China under final review
item.description: The proposals are part of the Joe Biden administration's efforts to restrict the flow of U.S. capital, technology and expertise into China.

item.title: China tightens export controls for tech and goods with military use, ahead of Xi's trip to Russia
item.description: China unveiled a set of regulations on export control of goods and technologies that could be used for military purposes.

item.title: Microsoft to roll out new autonomous AI agents next month, fending off challenge from Salesforce
item.description: Microsoft will allow organizations to create their own autonomous AI agents within Copilot starting next month.

item.title: Britain faces warnings of a tech exodus over tax plans ahead of high-stakes budget
item.description: Technology bosses and investors warn the U.K. could face an exodus of entrepreneurs if the government hikes capital gains tax — a levy on investment profits.
